channel.title: POLITICO Influence
channel.description: Delivered daily, Influence gives you a comprehensive rundown and analysis of all lobby hires and news on K Street.

item.title: Senate Judiciary advances effort to limit foreign influence
item.description: The Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance a bill that would ban former senior government officials from lobbying for foreign “countries of concern.”
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Generic, biotech lobbies add new outside firms
item.description: The Association for Accessible Medicines, which represents generic drugmakers, is expanding its roster of hired guns.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Ballard launches Western Hemisphere practice
item.description: Ballard Partners has launched a new practice group dedicated to helping clients navigate the geopolitical upheaval under way across the Western Hemisphere.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Manatt picks up another batch of Holland & Knight clients
item.description: Manatt, Phelps & Phillips has registered to lobby for a half-dozen local government clients previously represented by lobbyists who decamped for Holland & Knight last year.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Ballard name gets pulled into Mangione case
item.description: Lawyers for Luigi Mangione, the accused murderer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, are making a novel argument to get their client’s death penalty case thrown out.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Seven Letter expands in LA, NYC and Huntsville
item.description: The move is the firm’s largest expansion to date, raising its total number of offices to five from its current two locations in Washington and Boston.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Vance-linked firm sets up shop in DC
item.description: New Jersey-based government affairs shop MAD Global Strategy is expanding to D.C.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Gowdy joins Miller Strategies
item.description: Former Rep. Trey Gowdy is joining Miller Strategies, the lobbying shop led by top GOP fundraiser Jeff Miller, as of counsel.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: What K Street is watching for in 2026
item.description: The capital’s lobbyist class is preparing for a 2026 that promises to be just as tumultuous as last year.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Turning to K Street to save Christmas
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Tech’s hidden hand in the kids online safety battle
item.description: Social media platforms have spent the past three years fending off congressional efforts that would force platforms to take a firmer hand in mitigating issues related to mental health, addiction and bullying of kids and teens online.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Google taps KDCR for permitting push
item.description: “A federal judge in Brooklyn on Monday declared a mistrial in the case of Linda Sun, a former aide to Democratic governors who was accused of working as an agent of China, after jurors said they could not reach a verdict,” The New York Times’ Santul Nerkar and Anusha Bayya report.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Zyn competitor makes first K Street hire
item.description: A nicotine pouch startup aiming to compete with Zyn has hired Checkmate Government Relations as its first Washington lobbying firm.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: How Trump came around on marijuana
item.description: Donald Trump’s executive order to ease restrictions on marijuana is the culmination of more than a yearlong campaign by the cannabis industry.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes, Caitlin Oprysko and Natalie Fertig
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes, Caitlin Oprysko and Natalie Fertig

item.title: Notre Dame adds K St. powerhouse
item.description: The University of Notre Dame has added another K Street heavyweight to its bench of outside lobbying firms.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Tech revs up for the midterms
item.description: Tech companies and lobbyists are investing millions of dollars to tackle a new political problem for the industry.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Tim Scott’s chief heads to K Street
item.description: Charles Cogar, who has worked for Scott since 2013 — most recently as chief of staff — has joined Holland & Hart as a senior director of federal affairs.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Firm fighting Trump receives bipartisan praise
item.description: Congressional Republicans and Democrats came together for a bipartisan event celebrating the release of a newly updated handbook on congressional investigations.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Lanza lands Lukoil account
item.description: Bryan Lanza is now a consultant to the international division of Russia oil company Lukoil.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Lippman, Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Lippman, Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Longtime hospitals chief is departing
item.description: Rick Pollack is stepping down as president and CEO of the American Hospital Association after more than four decades.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: How one K Street firm is integrating AI
item.description: Signal Group’s Signal Labs is rolling out a proprietary AI-powered reputation management tool built specifically with public affairs in mind.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Warner Bros. megadeal triggers a lobbying bonanza
item.description: Lobbying armies are being amassed in real time as the media giants vying to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery — Netflix and Paramount Skydance — game out the Washington landscape in pursuit of their prize.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Lippman
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Lippman

item.title: New firm bridges Washington with Hawaii
item.description: A pair of lobbyists with roots in Hawaii Democratic politics have teamed up with the former chief lobbyist for Nike to launch a firm with offices in Honolulu and Washington.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: How some lobbyists view the Mike Johnson mess
item.description: K Street is keeping a close eye on Speaker Mike Johnson as his grip on his conference appears to be weakening.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Johnson aide jumps to Holland & Knight
item.description: Chris Jaarda has left the Hill to join Holland & Knight as a partner in the firm’s lobbying practice.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Paramount’s top lobbyist to depart
item.description: DeDe Lea is stepping down as the top global lobbyist for entertainment giant Paramount after nearly 30 years with the company or its predecessors.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Health lobbyists press for ACA extension
item.description: Health insurance premiums are set to go up for millions of Americans on New Year's Day if Congress is unable to reach an agreement to extend the subsidies.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Local governments flock to Manatt
item.description: Los Angeles-based Manatt, Phelps & Phillips is signing local government clients by the dozen.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: AI association reveals first advisory board
item.description: One of the newest trade associations in Washington, the National Artificial Intelligence Association, has appointed its inaugural advisory board.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Tech manufacturer hires Lanza amid calls for US ban
item.description: A Chinese-founded electronics manufacturer facing bipartisan calls for an investigation into its relationship with the Chinese government has hired Bryan Lanza.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
